page.title: 07BASING VILLAGE
page.content: Basing Village Basing is a parish lying to the north-east of Basingstoke and covers approximately 5300 acres. It is watered by the River Loddon, which rises west of Basingstoke and flows through its subsoil of London clay and chalk.The river once powered Old Basing Mill, dating from the 11th century.The mill has been converted into an inn and restaurant. Access is available to the remains of the water wheel and grinding stones that were used for grinding the village wheat into flour. There is a Victorian viaduct which carries a busy railway line from east to west crossing the River Loddon. Basing House was under siege for two years during the Civil War.
